subject: Re: "plain" formatter broken in Ant w/ JUnit 4.x?
msgSnippet: Jason, I have only seen this behaviour when combining JUnit 4.x and Ant 1.6.x. Ant 1.7 shows the testnames when used with JUnit 4.x: Testcase: pdfExists took

Jason,

I have only seen this behaviour when combining JUnit 4.x and Ant 
1=
.6.x.

Ant 1.7 shows the testnames when used with JUnit 4.x:

Testcase: pdf=
Exists took 0,015 sec
Testcase: pdfIsFile took 0 sec
Testcase: pdfIsNotEmpt=
y took 0 sec

Regards, Jan
